section.name: News And Status
section.h4: 16 May 2007 - Turbine becomes a top-level project of the ASF
section.p: At the May board meeting of the ASF a resolution to make Turbine a top-level project of the ASF was passed. This means we are leaving the umbrella of Jakarta to forge ahead on our own.
There will be a period of instability while the site, mailing lists, etc. are migrated from jakarta.apache.org to turbine.apache.org, but we hope to sort everything out in the near future.

You may be interested to know that there has been a fair bit of activity lately working towards a 2.3.3 release. There is still a little more work to do and a couple of dependencies we are waiting for, but this is shaping up to be a good step forward and long overdue update. Watch this space.

The Turbine Team is proud to announce the 1.3 release of M.E.T.A, the Maven Environment for Turbine Applications, a maven 1.x plugin for developing Turbine applications. Download source and binary releases through the Apache mirror system at the turbine download site or the central maven repository.

The Turbine Team is proud to announce the 2.3.2 release of the Turbine Web Application Framework.
Download source and binary releases through the Apache mirror system at the turbine download site or the central maven repository.

The Turbine team has decided to do some actual software paleontology and do a release of the long standing Turbine 2.3.x component layer called "Stratum". This release is intended as a closure to replace all the alpha and beta versions floating around. There is no further development beyond the 1.0 version planned.
Turbine and Turbine-related subjects are covered at ApacheCon EU 2005. We have listed the sessions that might be interesting for Turbineers on an extra page.

section.h4: 1 October 2004 - Turbine at OSCOM 4, Zürich, Switzerland
section.p: Rapid application prototyping with Turbine and Maven using the Maven Environment for Turbine Applications (META) will be presented at OSCOM 4 in Zürich.
The Turbine team is proud to announce the first milestone release of the Turbine 2.4 framework. This is intended to serve as a baseline for early adopters of the Turbine 2.4 framework.

Turbine is going to be covered at the ApacheCon 2003 in Las Vegas, Nevada with a three hour tutorial session and an one hour talk. So if you're interested in learning about what's new in the Turbine 2.3 framework or just want to have face time with the Turbine developers, come and meet us there.
